thread.title: Ed Sheeran receives an honorary degree
thread.title_full: Ed Sheeran receives an honorary degree - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Ed Sheeran receives an honorary degree
text:
KENA BETANCUR/AFP/Getty Images You can call him Dr. Ed Sheeran now. Congratulations, Dr. Sheeran!
Pop singer Ed Sheeran received an honorary doctorate degree for outstanding contribution to music from the University Campus Suffolk in his native England.
To celebrate, the "Thinking Out Loud" crooner posted a photo of himself on Instagram Monday donning a cap and gown.
teddysphotos via Instagram Ed Sheeran received an honorary doctorate in music from the University Campus Suffolk.
"I graduated today, I am now officially Dr. Sheeran," he captioned the picture.
Even before landing his new doctorate degree, the 24-year-old earned a reputation for making others feel better.
In 2014, he serenaded a dying fan, Triona Priestley, when he called her and sang "Little Bird.‚Äù The 15-year-old, who had been battling cystic fibrosis, reportedly died minutes later.
The degree is a huge honor for Sheeran, who quit school at 16 to pursue his music career.
His advice to aspiring musicians is to study a different kind of curriculum.
"If you want to be a singer then make sure you go to a lot of shows of people you really, really admire, study how they do it," he told BBC Newsbeat in 2012.
Chris Radburn/ap Ed Sheeran addresses fellow graduates during a graduation ceremony at University Campus Suffolk in Ipswich, where he received an honorary degree for his outstanding contribution to music.
"Do your own shows, work up your confidence, write as many songs as possible so each time you do a song it gets better and better and better."
mhood@nydailynews.com
